--- title: "Merging/Joining Multiple Datasets" order: 5 title-slide-attributes: data-background-gradient: linear-gradient(to top right, {{< brand color background >}}, {{< brand color pastelpink >}}, {{< brand color fmorange >}}, {{< brand color tangerine >}}) format: revealjs: margin: .15 quarto-required: ">= 1.6.0" width: 1600 height: 900 slide-number: "c" css: ../styles.css code-copy: true echo: true code-overflow: scroll --- ::: {.cell} ::: # Data {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom, #FFFFFF, #FFFFFF, #FECCDD)"} # Data: Women in science {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom, #FFFFFF, #FFFFFF, #FECCDD)"} Information on 10 women in science who changed the world ::: {.cell} ::: ## Inputs ::: {.panel-tabset} ### professions ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 2 name profession 1 Ada Lovelace Mathematician 2 Marie Curie Physicist and Chemist 3 Janaki Ammal Botanist 4 Chien-Shiung Wu Physicist 5 Katherine Johnson Mathematician 6 Rosalind Franklin Chemist 7 Vera Rubin Astronomer 8 Gladys West Mathematician 9 Flossie Wong-Staal Virologist and Molecular Biologist 10 Jennifer Doudna Biochemist ``` ::: ::: ### dates ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 8 Ã— 3 name birth_year death_year 1 Janaki Ammal 1897 1984 2 Chien-Shiung Wu 1912 1997 3 Katherine Johnson 1918 2020 4 Rosalind Franklin 1920 1958 5 Vera Rubin 1928 2016 6 Gladys West 1930 NA 7 Flossie Wong-Staal 1947 NA 8 Jennifer Doudna 1964 NA ``` ::: ::: ### works ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 9 Ã— 2 name known_for 1 Ada Lovelace first computer algorithm 2 Marie Curie theory of radioactivity, discovery of elementsâ€¦ 3 Janaki Ammal hybrid species, biodiversity protection 4 Chien-Shiung Wu confim and refine theory of radioactive beta deâ€¦ 5 Katherine Johnson calculations of orbital mechanics critical to sâ€¦ 6 Vera Rubin existence of dark matter 7 Gladys West mathematical modeling of the shape of the Earthâ€¦ 8 Flossie Wong-Staal first scientist to clone HIV and create a map oâ€¦ 9 Jennifer Doudna one of the primary developers of CRISPR, a grouâ€¦ ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.footnote} Source: [Discover Magazine](https://www.discovermagazine.com/the-sciences/meet-10-women-in-science-who-changed-the-world) ::: ## Desired output ::: {.cell content-overflow='nostretch'} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 5 name profession birth_year death_year known_for 1 Ada Lovelace Mathematician NA NA first coâ€¦ 2 Marie Curie Physicist and â€¦ NA NA theory oâ€¦ 3 Janaki Ammal Botanist 1897 1984 hybrid sâ€¦ 4 Chien-Shiung Wu Physicist 1912 1997 confim aâ€¦ 5 Katherine Johnson Mathematician 1918 2020 calculatâ€¦ 6 Rosalind Franklin Chemist 1920 1958 7 Vera Rubin Astronomer 1928 2016 existencâ€¦ 8 Gladys West Mathematician 1930 NA mathematâ€¦ 9 Flossie Wong-Staal Virologist andâ€¦ 1947 NA first scâ€¦ 10 Jennifer Doudna Biochemist 1964 NA one of tâ€¦ ``` ::: ::: ## Inputs, reminder ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} names(professions) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "name" "profession" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} names(dates) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "name" "birth_year" [3] "death_year" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} names(works) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "name" "known_for" ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} nrow(professions) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 10 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} nrow(dates) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 8 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} nrow(works) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 9 ``` ::: ::: ::: # Joining data frames {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFFFFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF)"} ## Joining data frames ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} something_join(x, y) ``` ::: - `left_join()`: all rows from x - `right_join()`: all rows from y - `full_join()`: all rows from both x and y - `semi_join()`: all rows from x where there are matching values in y, keeping just columns from x - `inner_join()`: all rows from x where there are matching values in y, return all combination of multiple matches in the case of multiple matches - `anti_join()`: return all rows from x where there are not matching values in y, never duplicate rows of x - ... ## Setup ::: {.cell} ::: For the next few slides... ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 id value_x 1 1 x1 2 2 x2 3 3 x3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 id value_y 1 1 y1 2 2 y2 3 4 y4 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `left_join()` ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/left-join.gif){width=80% style="background-color: #F0F0F0"} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} left_join(x, y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3 id value_x value_y 1 1 x1 y1 2 2 x2 y2 3 3 x3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `left_join()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} professions %>% left_join(dates) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 4 name profession birth_year death_year 1 Ada Lovelace Mathematician NA NA 2 Marie Curie Physicist and Chemist NA NA 3 Janaki Ammal Botanist 1897 1984 4 Chien-Shiung Wu Physicist 1912 1997 5 Katherine Johnson Mathematician 1918 2020 6 Rosalind Franklin Chemist 1920 1958 7 Vera Rubin Astronomer 1928 2016 8 Gladys West Mathematician 1930 NA 9 Flossie Wong-Staal Virologist and Molecularâ€¦ 1947 NA 10 Jennifer Doudna Biochemist 1964 NA ``` ::: ::: ## `right_join()` ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/right-join.gif){width=80% style="background-color: #F0F0F0"} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} right_join(x, y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3 id value_x value_y 1 1 x1 y1 2 2 x2 y2 3 4 y4 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `right_join()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} professions %>% right_join(dates) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 8 Ã— 4 name profession birth_year death_year 1 Janaki Ammal Botanist 1897 1984 2 Chien-Shiung Wu Physicist 1912 1997 3 Katherine Johnson Mathematician 1918 2020 4 Rosalind Franklin Chemist 1920 1958 5 Vera Rubin Astronomer 1928 2016 6 Gladys West Mathematician 1930 NA 7 Flossie Wong-Staal Virologist and Molecular â€¦ 1947 NA 8 Jennifer Doudna Biochemist 1964 NA ``` ::: ::: ## `full_join()` ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/full-join.gif){width=80% style="background-color: #F0F0F0"} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} full_join(x, y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 Ã— 3 id value_x value_y 1 1 x1 y1 2 2 x2 y2 3 3 x3 4 4 y4 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `full_join()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} dates %>% full_join(works) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 4 name birth_year death_year known_for 1 Janaki Ammal 1897 1984 hybrid species, biodiverâ€¦ 2 Chien-Shiung Wu 1912 1997 confim and refine theoryâ€¦ 3 Katherine Johnson 1918 2020 calculations of orbital â€¦ 4 Rosalind Franklin 1920 1958 5 Vera Rubin 1928 2016 existence of dark matter 6 Gladys West 1930 NA mathematical modeling ofâ€¦ 7 Flossie Wong-Staal 1947 NA first scientist to cloneâ€¦ 8 Jennifer Doudna 1964 NA one of the primary develâ€¦ 9 Ada Lovelace NA NA first computer algorithm 10 Marie Curie NA NA theory of radioactivity,â€¦ ``` ::: ::: ## `inner_join()` ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/inner-join.gif){width=80% style="background-color: #F0F0F0"} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} inner_join(x, y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 Ã— 3 id value_x value_y 1 1 x1 y1 2 2 x2 y2 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `inner_join()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} dates %>% inner_join(works) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 7 Ã— 4 name birth_year death_year known_for 1 Janaki Ammal 1897 1984 hybrid species, biodiversâ€¦ 2 Chien-Shiung Wu 1912 1997 confim and refine theory â€¦ 3 Katherine Johnson 1918 2020 calculations of orbital mâ€¦ 4 Vera Rubin 1928 2016 existence of dark matter 5 Gladys West 1930 NA mathematical modeling of â€¦ 6 Flossie Wong-Staal 1947 NA first scientist to clone â€¦ 7 Jennifer Doudna 1964 NA one of the primary develoâ€¦ ``` ::: ::: ## `semi_join()` ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/semi-join.gif){width=80% style="background-color: #F0F0F0"} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} semi_join(x, y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 Ã— 2 id value_x 1 1 x1 2 2 x2 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `semi_join()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} dates %>% semi_join(works) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 7 Ã— 3 name birth_year death_year 1 Janaki Ammal 1897 1984 2 Chien-Shiung Wu 1912 1997 3 Katherine Johnson 1918 2020 4 Vera Rubin 1928 2016 5 Gladys West 1930 NA 6 Flossie Wong-Staal 1947 NA 7 Jennifer Doudna 1964 NA ``` ::: ::: ## `anti_join()` ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/anti-join.gif){width=80% style="background-color: #F0F0F0"} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} anti_join(x, y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 Ã— 2 id value_x 1 3 x3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `anti_join()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} dates %>% anti_join(works) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 name birth_year death_year 1 Rosalind Franklin 1920 1958 ``` ::: ::: # {background-gradient="radial-gradient(#FFA219, #FFFFFF, #FFFFFF)"} ::: {.tip} ðŸ’¡Tip!

Order of the datasets matters when you join `anti_join(x, y)` is different from `anti_join(y, x)` ::: ## Putting it altogether ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|2|3"} professions %>% left_join(dates) %>% left_join(works) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 5 name profession birth_year death_year known_for 1 Ada Lovelace Mathematician NA NA first coâ€¦ 2 Marie Curie Physicist and â€¦ NA NA theory oâ€¦ 3 Janaki Ammal Botanist 1897 1984 hybrid sâ€¦ 4 Chien-Shiung Wu Physicist 1912 1997 confim aâ€¦ 5 Katherine Johnson Mathematician 1918 2020 calculatâ€¦ 6 Rosalind Franklin Chemist 1920 1958 7 Vera Rubin Astronomer 1928 2016 existencâ€¦ 8 Gladys West Mathematician 1930 NA mathematâ€¦ 9 Flossie Wong-Staal Virologist andâ€¦ 1947 NA first scâ€¦ 10 Jennifer Doudna Biochemist 1964 NA one of tâ€¦ ``` ::: ::: ## Putting it altogether - better syntax ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2,3"} professions %>% left_join(dates, by="name") %>% left_join(works, by="name") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 5 name profession birth_year death_year known_for 1 Ada Lovelace Mathematician NA NA first coâ€¦ 2 Marie Curie Physicist and â€¦ NA NA theory oâ€¦ 3 Janaki Ammal Botanist 1897 1984 hybrid sâ€¦ 4 Chien-Shiung Wu Physicist 1912 1997 confim aâ€¦ 5 Katherine Johnson Mathematician 1918 2020 calculatâ€¦ 6 Rosalind Franklin Chemist 1920 1958 7 Vera Rubin Astronomer 1928 2016 existencâ€¦ 8 Gladys West Mathematician 1930 NA mathematâ€¦ 9 Flossie Wong-Staal Virologist andâ€¦ 1947 NA first scâ€¦ 10 Jennifer Doudna Biochemist 1964 NA one of tâ€¦ ``` ::: ::: # Joining on multiple variables {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFFFFF, #FECCDD, #FECCDD, #FECCDD)"} ## Set-up for multiple variables join ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x_multi <- x %>% mutate(id2=c(4,5,6)) %>% select(id,id2,value_x) x_multi ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3 id id2 value_x 1 1 4 x1 2 2 5 x2 3 3 6 x3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} y_multi <- y %>% mutate(id2=c(4,6,8)) %>% select(id,id2,value_y) y_multi ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3 id id2 value_y 1 1 4 y1 2 2 6 y2 3 4 8 y4 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Left and right joins with multiple variables ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} x_multi %>% left_join(y_multi, by=c("id","id2")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 4 id id2 value_x value_y 1 1 4 x1 y1 2 2 5 x2 3 3 6 x3 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: {.column} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} x_multi %>% right_join(y_multi, by=c("id","id2")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 4 id id2 value_x value_y 1 1 4 x1 y1 2 2 6 y2 3 4 8 y4 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Full and inner joins with multiple variables ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} x_multi %>% full_join(y_multi, by=c("id","id2")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 Ã— 4 id id2 value_x value_y 1 1 4 x1 y1 2 2 5 x2 3 3 6 x3 4 2 6 y2 5 4 8 y4 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: {.column} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} x_multi %>% inner_join(y_multi, by=c("id","id2")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 Ã— 4 id id2 value_x value_y 1 1 4 x1 y1 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Semi and anti joins with multiple variables ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} x_multi %>% semi_join(y_multi, by=c("id","id2")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 Ã— 3 id id2 value_x 1 1 4 x1 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: {.column} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} x_multi %>% anti_join(y_multi, by=c("id","id2")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 Ã— 3 id id2 value_x 1 2 5 x2 2 3 6 x3 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: # Your turn:
Join data {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom, #FFFFFF, #FFFFFF, #6BE1CA)"} âœ‹ if you have questions or need help ``{=html} when you are finished ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
15:00
``` ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
